SouthSide Works is a 123-acre riverfront development located across the Hot Metal Bridge, just minutes from Pittsburgh’s Central Business District (CBD) and the educational and medical hub of Oakland. Somera Road Inc. manages the 34-acre portion of the property between East Carson Street and South Water Street, and from South 26th Street to Hot Metal Street.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located on Pittsburgh's South Side.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The 7-story building, which overlooks the Monongahela River, was built in the 1920s. Originally a warehouse for Gimbel’s department store, it was converted into offices in the 1990s. After Rugby Realty purchased the building in 2012, it was remodeled to preserve its industrial character, complementing that of the South Side. This led to features including high ceilings, large windows, and a glass curtain wall.

In addition to being just minutes away from South Side attractions, 2100 Wharton Street is near several parking lots and is conveniently located by highway and public transportation access. The building also offers fiber connectivity, strong linkages to the East End, and tenant-dedicated fitness and conference centers.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Once the tallest building in Pittsburgh, the Koppers Building has 35 floors and rises 475 feet above Downtown Pittsburgh. The outside of the building is constructed of polished granite for the first three floors and Indiana limestone for the rest. The impressive three-story lobby is lined with Italian Cremo, Spanish Rajo Alcante and Tennessee marbles. The Koppers Building has been referred to as one of the largest and best representations of Art Deco architecture of the 1920s and 1930s.

10,000 SF Conference Facility is located on the lower level and features five rooms; E.P Mellon, E. Graham, H. White, W. Anderson, and E. Probst. Each room includes kitchen access with a microwave, ice maker, dishwasher, and fridge. There is also 5,000 SF fitness center with men and women locker rooms in the building available to all tenants.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Foster Plaza enjoys excellent visibility and access from I-376 and I-79. Situated in Green Tree Borough, the park boasts an exceptional location that is only 5 miles away from downtown Pittsburgh and 15 miles to the Pittsburgh International Airport.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Foster Plaza is comprised of ten buildings of Class A suburban office space totaling over one million square feet. Double-paned, insulated reflection glass and either precast concrete or bonded fiberglass panels make the complex architecturally appealing and energy efficient. An abundance of oversized parking spaces surround each building to ensure convenient access for both tenants and guests. 

It features a variety of office buildings with varying floor plans and suite sizes allowing the park to accommodate tenants of all sizes. The amenities at Foster Plaza include state-of-the-art event, conference, and training centers, a tenant lounge, a food hall, and a community space. On-site free parking, daycare facilities, and nearby restaurants are also available.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Foster Plaza is the premier choice for corporate tenants who desire a newly renovated, Class A suburban office space near the central business district with free parking and best-in-class amenities.
